body.p: You must remove the monitor node(s) based on your deployment. For example, if you have deployed your monitor node on the controller node, refer the procedure mentioned in Remove monitor node(s) from controller node and if you have deployed monitor node on a dedicated resource node, refer procedure mentioned in Remove monitor node from a separate/dedicated node(s).

section.title: Remove monitor node(s) from controller node
section.p:
Permanent removal of a monitor is not supported when the monitor service is installed on a controller node. However, to temporarily bring down the service on the controller node (for maintenance purposes), perform the following steps:
Login to the deployer node.
Create a file name mon-node-to-remove and add the monitor hostname(s) (say in above example padawan-ceph-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt) to the file. (sample is required like OSD removal)
Stop the monitor service running on the specific host by executing the following commands:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-stop.yml --limit @mon-node-to-remove
Remove the monitor service from the clusterceph mon remove <ceph-mon-host>

section.title: Remove monitor node from a separate/dedicated node
section.p:
Perform the following steps to remove monitor node from a separate/dedicated node.
Login to the monitor node to be removed. (command to login??)
Stop the monitor service running on the specific host by executing the following commands :service ceph-mon@<ceph-mon-host> stop
Remove the monitor serviceceph mon remove <ceph-mon-host>
Login to the deployer node.
Edit servers.yml file and remove the host section from file.vim ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml
Commit your configurationcd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Remove monitor node <host-name>"
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.ymlReplace the string <host-name> in the above commit message with the actual host name.
